comments:
If a project has an ejb module (along with a web module), opening up the servlet
wizard will leave the folder edit field blank.  If you enter anything that
doesn't start with the project folder into the edit field, you will get an
exception when trying to finish the wizard.
Steps:
1.  Create a flex java project (I used JBoss 3.2.3 as the server)
2.  Create an ejb module for that project
3.  Create a web module for that project
4.  Open the servlet wizard -- notice folder edit field is empty.
5.  Enter "myFolder" into folder (not full path from project)
6.  Fill out package and class name fields to enable Finish button
7.  Finish -- get error dialog with following exception:

Changed Version field given new release numbering.
This is fixed for the 0628 WTP I build.

Exception no longer happens, but trying to type in a new folder name brings up 
an error message in the dialog that the folder path must be absolute -- 
however, trying to type in a system absolute path does not work either -- an 
absolute path relative to the project is what appears to be required.  Maybe 
the error message could indicate this behavior better?

"Source folder path must be a project relative absolute path."

fixed for wtp 0712 WTP I

This bug is being moved to the "closed" state since it has been in the fixed state for a so long it is being assumed fixed, without explicit verification from the originator. If there is still a problem, in the most recent 1.5.x builds, please reopen or open another bug.

causedBy.message: Path must include project and resource name: /myFolder
